Publications

Below is a comprehensive list of my published research. My work primarily focuses on pharmacovigilance, patient safety, medication errors, and the rational use of medicines. For the most updated list, you can also visit my ResearchGate profile.

Assessment of Knowledge of Medical Undergraduate Students by Allotting Them ADR Reporting Activity and by Questionnaire Method

December 2020 | Journal of Medical Research and Innovation

Rashmi Singla, Rangeel Singh Raina, Dev Chaudhary

This study evaluated the knowledge and awareness of Adverse Drug Reaction reporting among medical undergraduate students using practical reporting activities and questionnaire-based assessment.

Read More
View Publication

Retrospective analysis on adverse drug reactions prevalence in the female population of Tertiary Care Hospital

October 2020 | Journal of Drug Delivery and Therapeutics

Rangeel Singh Raina, Sona Bharti Kaushal

This retrospective study analyzed the incidence rate, clinical manifestations, and causative agents for adverse drug reactions in female patients, highlighting gender-specific patterns in drug reactions.

Read More
View Publication

Impact of awareness and knowledge about different types of drug-related interactions among nurses in a tertiary health center

January 2020 | International Journal of Basic & Clinical Pharmacology

Shreya Joshi, Rangeel Singh Raina, Atul Singh

This study assessed nurses' awareness and knowledge regarding different types of drug interactions, identifying knowledge gaps and suggesting educational interventions to improve medication safety practices.

Read More
View Publication

The Zest for Patient Empowerment

June 2016 | Journal of Basic and Clinical Pharmacy

Rangeel Singh Raina

This article explores the concept of patient empowerment as an active, self-determining role for patients rather than passive recipients of healthcare services, emphasizing the importance of provider-patient relationships.

Read More
View Publication

Emerging Ethical Perspective in Physician-Patient Relationship

November 2014 | Journal of Clinical and Diagnostic Research

Rangeel Singh Raina, Priyanka Singh, Aditi Chaturvedi, Deepak Parihar

This paper examines the evolving ethical dimensions in physician-patient relationships, highlighting the shift from traditional paternalistic models to more patient-centered approaches that emphasize shared decision-making.

Read More
View Publication
